intro: Dregea taynguyenensis, commonly known as the Tay Nguyen dregea, is a flowering plant native to Vietnam. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
